alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Muscogee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 6:30AM EDT until April 09 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Clarke Counties. Oconee River near Dublin affecting Wilkinson, Laurens, Washington and Johnson Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Alabama... Flint River near Carsonville Hwy. 19 affecting Talbot, Upson, Taylor and Crawford Counties. Oconee River near Milledgeville affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Baldwin Counties. Chattahoochee River at Columbus affecting Muscogee, Chattahoochee, Lee and Russell Counties. Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Jones, Houston, Bibb, Monroe and Twiggs Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chattahoochee River at Columbus. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 28 feet, Minor flooding continues along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the 14th Street bridge. Portions of the River Walk in Columbus will be flooded around one foot deep and closed to the public. The Phenix City Amphitheater on the Alabama side will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM CDT Friday /5:30 AM EDT Friday/ the stage was 26.7 feet and steady. - Forecast...The river could potentually rise rise to 28.5 feet this morning. It would then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 27 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
